question_sentence: How many of the Tory MPs who voted to overhaul Parliament’s sleaze watchdog have been investigated by the regulator?
evidence: Tory MP Owen Paterson resigned after Boris Johnson U-turned to allow a fresh vote on his suspension over a lobbying breach, and retreated on plans to rewrite conduct  rules

question_sentence: What is the name of the Republican candidate whose victory in  the election to choose the next Virginia governor is causing alarm in the Joe Biden administration?
evidence: The surprise win by millionaire former private equity CEO Youngkin is widely viewed as a national bellwether for next year’s midterms

question_sentence: The government of which African country declared a state of emergency and urged citizens to ‘take up arms’ to protect the capital from a rebel surge?
evidence: The call came as the Tigray People’s Liberation Front announced the capture of two cities within 250 miles of Addis Ababa

question_sentence: Which author won the 2021 Booker Prize after being shortlisted twice before for the top literary award?
evidence: The South African novelist won the award for The Promise, a portrait of a white family navigating the end of apartheid

question_sentence: Universities in what European country were told to review all links with China following allegations of ‘high-level influence’?
evidence: The warning came after ‘the launch of a German biography’ of China’s President Xi Jinping ‘was cancelled under alleged diplomatic pressure’, The Times reported

question_sentence: The chief executive of which banking giant quit following an investigation into his links with late convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein?
evidence: Jes Staley stepped down after receiving the draft findings of the probe by UK financial regulators. The watchdogs launched the investigation last year after their US counterparts shared a cache of emails between the two men

question_sentence: The UK has become the first country in the world to approve the use of which ‘game-changer’ anti-Covid pill?
evidence: Elderly people, diabetics and people with heart disease will be top of the list for treatment with Molnupiravir, the first oral antiviral for Covid-19, which has been given the green light by the UK medicines regulator

question_sentence: Professor Kathleen Stock resigned from which university following a long-running dispute over her views on transgenderism?
evidence: Philosophy professor Stock quit after allegedly being subjected to a campaign of ‘bullying and harassment’ by students who objected to her views about gender identity

question_sentence: Investigators have said that the recent train smash in Salisbury was probably caused by what?
evidence: A preliminary investigation suggested that ‘wheel slide’ was a key factor in the collision between a South Western Railway (SWR) train and Great Western Railway (GWR) train at Salisbury Tunnel Junction on the evening of 31 October

question_sentence: Who warned that the Covid crisis was ‘a long way from over’ as they quit the Scientific  Advisory Group for Emergencies (Sage)?
evidence: The leading scientist had been advocating for a ‘vaccine plus’ strategy, with more mask-wearing, greater focus on ventilation and continued coronavirus testing

question_sentence: Covid-19 deaths just surpassed which stunning figure?
evidence: According to new data released by the Johns Hopkins University Coronavirus Resource Center, more than 5 million people around the world have died of Covid-19.

question_sentence: More than 100 countries at this week’s COP26 summit in Glasgow signed on to an agreement about a topic that President Joe Biden said is as important as reducing carbon emissions. What was the focus of the pledge?
evidence: The deal, signed by over 100 countries – including Canada, Russia and Brazil; all countries with massive tracts of forest – committed to ending and reversing deforestation and land degradation by 2030.

question_sentence: All eyes were on Virginia this week as Republican Glenn Youngkin won a hotly anticipated governor’s race there. In another critical race, which state reelected a Democratic governor for the first time in four decades?
evidence: In a narrowly decided vote, New Jersey reelected Gov Phil Murphy, making him the first Democratic governor to win reelection there since Brendan Byrne in 1977.

question_sentence: Which specific Covid-19 vaccine is now authorized and recommended by the CDC for use in children ages 5-11?
evidence: The Pfizer vaccine – with one-third of the dose used in adults – is authorized for use in children ages 5-11, a move that will now allow 28 million children in the US to be vaccinated against Covid-19.

question_sentence: Which Supreme Court Justice had to call in sick this week and listened to hearings from home because of a “stomach bug?”
evidence: After receiving multiple negative Covid-19 tests, Justice Neil Gorsuch called in sick, all “out of an abundance of caution,” according to a court spokeswoman.

question_sentence: Which country has agreed to a new $650 million weapons deal with the United States?
evidence: The State Department notified Congress of a $650 million arms deal with Saudi Arabia, the second such deal with the country under the Biden administration.

question_sentence: What is one of the biggest priorities for space exploration over the next decade, according to the newly-published Astro2020 decadal survey?
choices: inventing new modes of space travel
evidence: The Astro2020 decadal survey is setting its sites on a range of topics including identifying life-supporting, ‘habitable worlds’ outside our own solar system to understanding how galaxies originated and evolve.

question_sentence: Which region or country could see half a million more Covid-19 related deaths by February because of case surges and localized spread?
evidence: According to WHO regional director Hans Kluge, Europe is “at the epicenter” of the pandemic with transmission across the region “of grave concern” and deaths possibly reaching 500,000 by February.

question_sentence: What popular series was the inspiration behind a cryptocurrency scheme that has defrauded investors of an estimated $2.1 million?
evidence: The scheme – all the result of an insider maneuver called a “rug pull” — involved a cryptocurrency called SQUID, named after the Netflix series “Squid Game.”

question_sentence: The Atlanta Braves beat the Houston Astros in the World Series. When was the last time the Braves won the title?
evidence: The Brave’s win in Game 6 of the World Series marks the team’s first title since 1995.
